sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DotNET CLR Usage Log Artifact
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of Usage Log files by the CLR (clr.dll). These files are named after the executing process once the assembly is finished executing for the first time in the (user) session context.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=ProcessHostingdotNETCode; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Microsoft\CLR_v4.0_32\UsageLogs\mshta.exe.log}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Registry Tampering by Potentially Suspicious Processes
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects suspicious registry modifications made by suspicious processes such as script engine processes such as WScript, or CScript etc.
These processes are rarely used for legitimate registry modifications, and their activity may indicate an attempt to modify the registry
without using standard tools like regedit.exe or reg.exe, potentially for evasion and persistence.

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ZoneMap\ProxyBypass}

@{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ZoneMap\IntranetName}

@{Details=DWORD (0x00000000); EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\mshta.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1070296143-2877979003-364783958-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ZoneMap\AutoDetect}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious LNK Double Extension File Created
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of files with an "LNK" as a second extension. This is sometimes used by malware as a method to abuse the fact that Windows hides the "LNK" extension by default.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\7za.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\sefm3kyk.noq\Online JLPT Exam Dec 2025\Online JLPT Exam Dec 2025.pdf.lnk}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=CDD462E86EC0F20DE2A1D781928B1B0C,SHA256=224A746AEE2957C3FCA376F4457CFC044C1EC99E75756195B27CAB396174E2DB,IMPHASH=869B9FF91668F96EF68FBE0DB3602587; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Users\Public\core\tempflow.bat" "; CommandLine=REG  ADD "HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /V "Push" /t REG_SZ /F /D "C:\Users\Public\core\flowB.bat"; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

attributes.magic: Zip archive data, at least v2.0 to extract, compression method=store

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
